required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Post-operative Sore Throat After Scheduled General Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Post-operative Sore Throat After Scheduled General Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: Precise description of the technique for intubation or laryngeal mask placement during general anesthesia Research on factors that can influence sore throat due to the placement of an endobuccal or endotracheal device during general anesthesia

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At exit of the post-interventional monitoring room, at 24 hours of surgery or exit of hospital

secondary_outcome.measure: type of sore throat risk factor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At exit of the post-interventional monitoring room, at 24 hours of surgery or exit of hospital
secondary_outcome.description: (technique of intubation, analgesic treatment for surgeryâ€¦)

intervention.description: Healthy subjects ; requiring general anesthesia with endotracheal or endobuccal device

study_pop.textblock: Patient to be operated on in the Department of Surgical Specialties, Neurosurgery, Orthopaedics and Pediatric Surgery at the University Hospital of Lille

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- General Anesthesia required Endotracheal or endobuccal device
Exclusion Criteria:
- Tracheotomy per or post surgery
- Patient with pre-operative pharyngeal irritation.
- Patient with a prior respiratory tract infection.
- Surgery of the laryngeal or tracheal vein, old or new
- Surgery scheduled less than 24 hours ago.
